sentences.english: I hear as if sing lonely to me.
sentences.chinese: 我徬佛听到寂寞怼莪唱歌。

sentences.english: As they picked tea, the girls sang happily.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们一边采茶，一边愉快地唱歌。

sentences.english: Old Major cleared his throat and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 老麦哲清了清嗓子开始唱歌。

sentences.english: Bell sitting on his roof, sings delightedly.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔坐在自家屋顶上乐滋滋地唱歌。

sentences.english: But it’s hard, a bit like learning to sing by watching MTV.
sentences.chinese: 但这很困难，有点类似于跟着MTV学唱歌。

sentences.english: They say she plays guitar and cries and sings.
sentences.chinese: 大家都话她识弹结他，又识鬼咁叫同唱歌仔。

sentences.english: Sally's party piece is singing whilst standing on her hands.
sentences.chinese: 萨利的派对绝活儿是倒立唱歌。

sentences.english: How old were you when you started learning singing?
sentences.chinese: 你开始学习唱歌时几岁了？

sentences.english: I think you looked as if you were half-asleep throughout the song.
sentences.chinese: 你唱歌的时候，看起来处在半睡眠状态。

sentences.english: Hiber was singing while the others were dancing.
sentences.chinese: 海博在唱歌，而其他人在跳舞。

sentences.english: I don't like the way they husked the songs.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢他们那种以粗哑的嗓音唱歌的方法。

sentences.english: When the owl sings,the nightingale will hold her peace.
Each time I hear Mr. Goh singing, already I know that he has drunk alot.
sentences.chinese: 每次我听见高先生唱歌，就知道他喝了很多酒。

sentences.english: But Darlene Love sang lead vocals with the Blossoms singing background.
sentences.chinese: 但达林爱唱唱歌的花朵背景主唱。

sentences.english: We drank cheap Shancheng Beer, we joked around, we took turns singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 我们喝了廉价的山城啤酒，我们开玩笑，轮流唱歌。

definition: to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
sung performance/to sing for an audience
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
